description:
"Ugh, why does Unicode have to be so complicated? It's just text, why
can't it be as simple as writing a note for myself?"

One of the more controversial changes in Python 3 is the decision to
handle text data entirely as Unicode code points. In this presentation,
CPython core developer Nick Coghlan will explore some of the background
of that design decision, the capabilities it grants Python 3 over Python
2, and some of the related features of the upcoming Python 3.5 release.
title: Python's Transition to Multilingual Programming
